intro: Odontocarpa coronata, commonly known as the crown coral tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
